text: `Fetching: [========================================>]  99.9 %` is this a known problem? julia nightly is quite a bit slower installing things, it often hangs a while at 99.9% fetching the registry

elements.text: is this a known problem? julia nightly is quite a bit slower installing things, it often hangs a while at 99.9% fetching the registry

text: try deleting and re-adding the general registry. That fixed it for me

elements.text: try deleting and re-adding the general registry. That fixed it for me

text: the only reason I can think of that would have any effect is if you previously had a git cloned registry and aftewards it switches to downloading tarballs, or on Windows it could be vice versa

elements.text: the only reason I can think of that would have any effect is if you previously had a git cloned registry and aftewards it switches to downloading tarballs, or on Windows it could be vice versa

text: it would be good to know which one was being slow

elements.text: it would be good to know which one was being slow

text: for me it was using the git version on master (linux)

elements.text: for me it was using the git version on master (linux)

text: that’s the one that was slow?

elements.text: that’s the one that was slow?

text: I guess that’s good since that’s the one we’re moving away from

elements.text: I guess that’s good since that’s the one we’re moving away from

text: for me it was opposite, PkgServer was slow and I had to set `JULIA_PKG_SERVER` to the empty string to fix it... I'm on WSL1 with all WSL directories excluded from the windows antivirus, so it shouldn't try to scan things at all

elements.text: for me it was opposite, PkgServer was slow and I had to set
to the empty string to fix it... I'm on WSL1 with all WSL directories excluded from the windows antivirus, so it shouldn't try to scan things at all

text: The WSL1 linux filesystem is particularly slow. With the PkgServer, we download a tar.gz and extract a few thousand files from it. I would expect that kind of use would bring wls1 fs to it's knees.

elements.text: The WSL1 linux filesystem is particularly slow. With the PkgServer, we download a tar.gz and extract a few thousand files from it. I would expect that kind of use would bring wls1 fs to it's knees.

text: note that there are plans for 1.7 to never decompress the tar, which should help with this. It's kind of amazing how bad Windows is with dealing with small files though. NTFS was pretty good when it was new, but it is long in need of a replacement

elements.text: note that there are plans for 1.7 to never decompress the tar, which should help with this. It's kind of amazing how bad Windows is with dealing with small files though. NTFS was pretty good when it was new, but it is long in need of a replacement

text: I don’t think I’ve ever used julia on windows in my life :stuck_out_tongue: my 99.9% hickup is on linux

elements.text: I don’t think I’ve ever used julia on windows in my life
